dspace-development.title: Symplectic Elements: Searching queues seem frozen

comments.body:
After a brief pairing session with Symplectic Support, it was discovered that there are database connectivity issues affecting the server for Elements:

```powershell
2022-04-28 14:07:48: Exception on machine: NetBIOS name "CISDR201W", OS "Microsoft Windows NT 6.2.9200.0" (64-bit)
Software instance: Default, Software Version: 5.14.0.2013, Commit Hash: b1ac109d2f78883a8ae8ff767c364b06b3cb9dc8
Command ""D:\Symplectic\Elements\Scheduler.Service\Scheduler.Service.exe"" (32-bit)
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Log entry ID: fb9d958e-e209-489d-9eec-00057fe26179
Logged at: 14:07:48.941 28/04/22

Level 1:
-------
Exception type: System.Data.SqlClient.SqlException
Message: A network-related or instance-specific error occurred while establishing a connection to SQL Server. The server was not found or was not accessible. Verify that the instance name is correct and that SQL Server is configured to allow remote connections. (provider: Named Pipes Provider, error: 40 - Could not open a connection to SQL Server)
Stack trace:
at System.Data.SqlClient.SqlInternalConnectionTds..ctor(DbConnectionPoolIdentity, SqlConnectionString, SqlCredential, Object, String, SecureString, Boolean, SqlConnectionString, SessionData, DbConnectionPool, String, Boolean, SqlAuthenticationProviderManager)

at System.Data.ProviderBase.DbConnectionPool.CreateObject(DbConnection, DbConnectionOptions, DbConnectionInternal)

at System.Data.ProviderBase.DbConnectionPool.TryGetConnection(DbConnection, UInt32, Boolean, Boolean, DbConnectionOptions, DbConnectionInternal&)
at System.Data.ProviderBase.DbConnectionPool.TryGetConnection(DbConnection, TaskCompletionSource<DbConnectionInternal>, DbConnectionOptions, DbConnectionInternal&)
at System.Data.ProviderBase.DbConnectionFactory.TryGetConnection(DbConnection, TaskCompletionSource<DbConnectionInternal>, DbConnectionOptions, DbConnectionInternal, DbConnectionInternal&)
at System.Data.ProviderBase.DbConnectionInternal.TryOpenConnectionInternal(DbConnection, DbConnectionFactory, TaskCompletionSource<DbConnectionInternal>, DbConnectionOptions)
at System.Data.ProviderBase.DbConnectionClosed.TryOpenConnection(DbConnection, DbConnectionFactory, TaskCompletionSource<DbConnectionInternal>, DbConnectionOptions)
at System.Data.SqlClient.SqlConnection.TryOpenInner(TaskCompletionSource<DbConnectionInternal>)
at System.Data.SqlClient.SqlConnection.TryOpen(TaskCompletionSource<DbConnectionInternal>)
at System.Data.SqlClient.SqlConnection.Open()
at Symplectic.Data.TransactionManager.NewScope(Boolean, Boolean, Nullable<IsolationLevel>) in libraries\Symplectic.Data\GenericTransactionManager.cs:line 224, char 6
at Symplectic.Data.GenericTransactionManager<N, C, A, R, T>.ExecuteReader(C, CommandBehavior, Action) in libraries\Symplectic.Data\GenericTransactionManager.cs:line 932, char 4
at Symplectic.Elements.DataAccess.ElementsDatabase.GetJobs(Nullable<Int32>) in elements\DataAccess\ElementsDatabase.cs:line 383, char 4
at Symplectic.Elements.DataAccess.ElementsDatabase.GetAllJobSchedules() in elements\DataAccess\ElementsDatabase.cs:line 365, char 31
at Symplectic.Elements.Scheduler.Service.Scheduler.UpdateSchedule(OperationSource) in elements\Scheduler.Service\Scheduler.cs:line 208, char 6
at Symplectic.Elements.Scheduler.Service.Scheduler.MainTimerTick(Object) in elements\Scheduler.Service\Scheduler.cs:line 867, char 5

SQL-specific information:

SQL Error:
	Class: 20
	Number: 53
	State: 0
	Provider: .Net SqlClient Data Provider
	Server: 
	Procedure: 
	Line number: 0

Level 2:
-------
Exception type: System.ComponentModel.Win32Exception

Exception not yet thrown.
```
In response to this, I am afraid that I am going to need to submit a SN@P support request to try and diagnose the database connectivity issues with the OIT.
This is now being tracked with https://princeton.service-now.com/now/workspace/agent/record/incident/6406ee4f874f0d1452d1edfd0ebb3599

figgy.title: Resources updated in Pulfalight should update their metadata in Figgy automatically.

comments.body:
endpoint `/resources/update_metadata` expects a body like `{ source_metadata_identifiers: [...] }` or `{ archival_collection_codes: [...] }`. For this ticket implement the code path for `archival_collection_codes`.

Implementation

- I get a list of things
- I kick of a job for each thing in the list
- That spawns a job per figgy resource that actually fetches the record/s from pulfalight
- See if metadata changed somehow before we persist to prevent needlessly re-preserving.
  - Note that the source metadata sync happens in the change set persister; we would have to compare up front somehow
- Use batches?
  - Would let us see the hierarchy of these jobs.

Example:

- I update C0001_c01 in ASpace
- Pulfalight hears that C001 changed.
- Pulfalight reindexes the full collection, because it has to, that’s how Pulfalight works.
- Pulfalight posts to figgy /resources/update_metadata with body { archival_collection_codes: [“C0001”] }
- Figgy hears the request, spawns a job for updating per collection code, returns “202 Accepted”.
  - queue low priority
- That job gets all resources which have that archival collection code, and spawns a metadata refresh job for each of those resources.
- The metadata refresh job should try to update, if nothing changes then don’t persist.
  - This metadata refresh job should be in the low priority queue.
- How many jobs per metadata update?
  - End up with one job per resource to be updated.

comments.body: @ccleeton that search groups results by collection. Unfortunately, there is no keyword highlighting in the Grouped Results. If you click on All Results, you will see that it's matching on "Kenneth". If you want to search for an exact match for "Kenneth Kuan-Sheng Chen", you need to put the full name in quotes.
Ahhh lets keep this open because it is not intuitive or clear
@phoebeno also notes "I always get CFR when I am typing in a name that does not exist anywhere else"
reopening until it's deployed and the full reindex is run.
